title: Kimi-Audio: An Open-Source Audio Foundation Model for Audio Understanding, Generation, and Conversation
author: Kimi Team
relevance_why: Kimi-Audio directly relates to audio generation and understanding, fields that are central to Haohe Liu's research in text-to-audio generation and audio processing.
background: Building a versatile audio model that understands, generates, and converses in audio by leveraging advancements in large language models and continuous audio features.
contribution: Kimi-Audio introduces a novel audio foundation model architecture that effectively processes both audio and text to achieve state-of-the-art performance in multiple audio-related tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous audio models generally target specific tasks like speech recognition or audio generation separately or lack open-source access.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines audio and language processing in a unified architecture, utilizing an innovative hybrid tokenization approach to improve efficiency and comprehension.

key_innovation: By integrating discrete semantic audio tokens with continuous acoustic vectors, Kimi-Audio allows for better perception and richer generation capabilities in audio tasks.
real_world_impact: Kimi-Audio's open-source nature and its ability to perform various audio-related tasks can significantly contribute to advancements in speech technology and audio processing applications.

new_terms.detokenizer: **Detokenizer** is a component that converts semantic tokens back into a format that can be understood, such as audio waveforms.
new_terms.vector quantization: **Vector quantization** is a process for compressing data by representing it as a set of vectors derived from a fixed codebook.

open_sourcing: The code, model checkpoints, and evaluation toolkits are available at https://github.com/MoonshotAI/Kimi-Audio.
